column3: nit: the second passage of the commit-message is now wrong, this was only true for the initial version of this pull-request, I'd say remove it, to avoid someone gets confused by it.\n

needs rebase.

GUI and RPC looks good. Nice @cozz! Thanks for the rebase and rework @laanwj.

The new parameter for `sendmany` (json object) looks a bit as a overdose to me. A single boolean would maybe be sufficient. 

Tested ACK.

With regard to future extensibility, I like the idea of adding a JSON structure to sendmany. Should have been done that in the first place instead of the long-winded positional command lines for some methods. \n

Agreed. JSON structures as parameter (or as optional parameter) would be more convenient and extendable. `sandmany` and `sendfrom` are also marked for deprecation so i assume main focus should be GUI and `sendtoaddress`.\n
eh, who is deprecating sendmany? If we were to keep one send\* method, that would be the one. It is the most general send method.\n

@laanwj The JSON structure in the current PR only allows for a boolean for each recipient. Are you suggesting it be changed to a parameter object (eg, like getblocktemplate)? If so, I agree that seems like a better approach.

As far as multiple recipients sharing the fee, it seems more logical to be using an Array than an Object with only values of "true".
help-description of sendmany is now wrong after switching from object to array\n
@cozz What's wrong about it? Looks fine to me?\n
- "A json object with addresses and booleans" - its not an object but an array and it doesnt take booleans\n- "Default for each address is false" - this sentence should be removed\n
@luke-jr @cozz Added a commit that fixes the help message.\n
I've squashed the two squashme commits, as well as @luke-jr's commit that reverts the changes to `sendfrom` (so that its API not touched at all).\n
this code-block needs to be moved one line above as the variable nBytes is used there\n
Do we really want to extend deprecated methods?\n
